meanings.sent1: She smiled seductively at him, trying to charm him with her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The dancer moved seductively across the stage, captivating the audience with her graceful movements.
meanings.sent3: The cat purred seductively as it rubbed against my leg, hoping for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The music seductively whispered in her ears, luring her to the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the room seductively, tempting everyone to indulge.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of seducing or enticing
meanings.sent1: Her seductively playful smile caught his attention immediately.
meanings.sent2: The seductively smooth fabric of the dress made her feel elegant and alluring.
meanings.sent3: The seductively sweet scent of the flowers made the garden a delightful place to relax.
meanings.sent4: The seductively mysterious stranger at the party intrigued everyone with his enigmatic aura.
meanings.sent5: The seductively soft music in the background created a romantic atmosphere in the restaurant.

meanings.sent1: The perfume she wore smelled seductively, drawing people closer to her.
meanings.sent2: The painting was displayed seductively in the art gallery, catching the eye of every visitor.
meanings.sent3: The sunlight filtered through the leaves, creating a seductively dappled pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed seductively against the shore, inviting beachgoers to relax and unwind.
meanings.sent5: The dessert was presented seductively on the plate, tempting everyone to take a bite.
